definitions.definition: A part of the rigging of a sailing ship extending from the top of the mast ( masthead ) to the back of the ship; they support the strain on all upper masts and provide additional support to the shrouds when the wind is abaft the beam .
A strengthening or supporting piece that is built into the back of something.

main_definition: ( nautical ) A part of the rigging of a sailing ship extending from the top of the mast ( masthead ) to the back of the ship; they support the strain on all upper masts and provide additional support to the shrouds when the wind is abaft the beam .
secondary_definitions: A strengthening or supporting piece that is built into the back of something.
